revised_title: Comparative Placental Structure in Apes and Human Females
tldr: The author compares the placental structure in apes and human females, finding close similarities in the form of the uterus, arrangement of foetal membranes, and the discoid placenta. Although there are some differences in the details of the structures, the overall construction and macroscopic and microscopic features show a close resemblance between the two.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy
